Forms a gel in the presence of calcium ions. Use for basic spherification.
Creates the gel reaction with sodium alginate. Can have a bitter taste.
Enzyme that cross-links proteins. Used to create uniform textures or bind different meats.
Can absorb high-fat liquids and turn them into powders. Derived from tapioca starch.
Used to create light, airy foams and airs. Stabilizes oil-in-water emulsions.
Complex aroma of mint, basil, and anise. Red shiso is used for coloring.
Distinctive hourglass-shaped leaves. Primarily used for aroma, not for juice.
Similar to ginger but more piney and citrusy. A key ingredient in Thai cuisine.
Creates a tingling, numbing sensation on the tongue (ma). Related to Sichuan pepper but more citrusy.
Grassy vanilla-like aroma with hints of coconut. Used in Southeast Asian desserts and savory dishes.
